meanings.definition: The olfactory lobes of the brain in certain animals, especially mammals.
meanings.sent1: The rhinencephala help animals smell different scents.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the rhinencephala to understand how animals detect odors.
meanings.sent3: The rhinencephala of the brain are like detectives sniffing out clues.
meanings.sent4: The rhinencephala are the scent-savvy part of the brain, always on the lookout for new aromas.
meanings.sent5: The rhinencephala are like tiny scent factories, producing the smells we perceive.

meanings.definition: The part of the brain responsible for processing smells.
meanings.sent1: When you smell a flower, your rhinencephala are hard at work.
meanings.sent2: The rhinencephala play a crucial role in identifying different odors.
meanings.sent3: Sometimes, the rhinencephala mix up the scents, making you think you smell something that isn't there.
meanings.sent4: The rhinencephala are the brain's scent processors, turning smells into recognizable signals.
meanings.sent5: Your rhinencephala are like the chefs of your brain, cooking up the delicious scents you experience.

meanings.definition: The region of the brain involved in olfaction.
meanings.sent1: The rhinencephala are like the headquarters for smelling in the brain.
meanings.sent2: In the rhinencephala, the magic of detecting scents happens.
meanings.sent3: If the brain were a city, the rhinencephala would be the aromatic district.
meanings.sent4: The rhinencephala are the scent interpreters of the brain, translating smells into signals.
meanings.sent5: Your rhinencephala are the scent specialists, decoding the fragrant messages around you.
